page.title: 15CHURCHES
page.content: The rector of All Saints Church, Gazeley is the Rev. Andrew Platt. He has been there for 6.5 years, and has several pets which he shares with his family, namely a cat, a dog and a goldfish. The Platt family are very good musicians playing guitars, piano, flute and auto-harp. Gazeley church was built around 1400 and is part of the reformed Deanery of Moulton, Gazeley, Kentford and Dalham, part of the Diocese of Midenhall of which the Rev. Platt is Rural Dean. A service is taken in each church every Sunday. The rector also looks after Brandon, Beck Row, Midenhall and Newmarket. A rota of ladies clean the church which can seat 200. There are a few roses and trees in the chuchyard. The Youth group meets regularly. A flower Festival is held each year for fund raising.
